data.event: The town which is now Lismore was first settled by Europeans when a John Brown was forced to stop to repair a wagon axle.
It broke while he forded the creek now named Brown's Waterholes.
Lismore Post Office opened on 1 December 1864.
Lismore grew through the years to become a prosperous service town for the surrounding fine wool producing properties.

event.title: the 1950s when many of the large properties of the area were divided up

data.event: Its peak of population was probably in the 1950s when many of the large properties of the area were divided up to make farms for returned soldiers.
